newsitem.title: UK: Australia assumes FAC Eurobond debt ahead of sale.
newsitem.headline: Australia assumes FAC Eurobond debt ahead of sale.

text.p: Australia will assume the obligation of Eurobonds issued by the Federal Airports Corporation (FAC) ahead of the sale of three airports, Australia said in a statement on Tuesday.

"To ensure a smooth transition to private ownership of the airports, the Commonwealth of Australia has decided to assume the obligations under bonds issued by the FAC," the statement, released by the Australian High Commission in London, said.
The FAC is wholly owned by Australia.
An agreement had been signed that will substitute Australia as principal debtor in place of the FAC for a $200 million 6.375 percent bond due 2003 and a A$100 million 7.0 percent bond due 2004.
Australia also plans to take over FAC's obligations on bonds issued under a A$600 million debt programme, the statement said.
The Australian government will be selling leases on Melbourne, Brisbane and Perth airports.
The airports are currently owned by the FAC, which is entirely owned by Australia.
